metadata.title: CVE-2014-3528 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Apache Subversion 1.0.0 through 1.7.x before 1.7.17 and 1.8.x before 1.8.10uses an MD5 hash of the URL and authentication realm to store cachedcredentials, which makes it easier for remote servers to obtain thecredentials via a crafted authentication realm.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3528` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-svn - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.1
libapache2-svn - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.1
libsvn-java - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.1
libsvn-perl - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.1
libsvn-ruby1.8 - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.1
libsvn1 - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.1
python-subversion - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.1
ruby-svn - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.1
subversion - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.1
subversion-tools - 1.8.8-1ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: subversion package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.8-1ubuntu3.1').
